alert.note: Alert for Taney (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 4:11AM CDT until March 26 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry, Stone and Taney. * WHEN...Until 330 PM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 410 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Branson, Kimberling City, Hollister, Silver Dollar City, Reeds Spring, Seligman, Indian Point, Branson West, Shell Knob, Golden, Table Rock, Emerald Beach, Kirbyville, Eagle Rock, Blue Eye, Chain-O-Lakes, Arrow Point, Coney Island, Lampe, Cape Fair, Ridgedale, Ozark Beach, Powersite, Table Rock Lake, Lake Taneycomo, Bull Shoals Lake, Table Rock State Park, Shepherd of the Hills State Park and Roaring River State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
